note:
- meta quest 3 has a wheel that allows users to tailor the tool to their eyes and face
- apple vision pro has motors and cameras adjusting the lenses to create a perfect match to any person's face
transcript: look at something basic like meta Quest 3 has this little wheel on the bottom that you can use to adjust the Optics inside well Apple didn't want to put this little physical wheel that you have to manually do instead there are literal Motors inside a vision pro it'll use the cameras to look at your eyes then adjust them the lenses so it matches you perfectly for the first time that you put it on

note:
- mitochondria convert food to atp for cells to use
- mitochondria consist of an outer membrane, inner membrane, and inner membrane space
- oxidative phosphorilation happens in mitochondria
transcript: mitochondria. Here, food is converted into chemical energy called ATP. ATP is released by the mitochondria,  so cells can use it. Mitochondria consists of two membranes, an outer membrane separating it from  the cytosol, and an inner membrane surrounding the so called matrix. The area between these  membranes is called the inter membrane space. ATP is generated at the inner membrane of mitochondria  by an efficient mechanism called oxidative phosphorylation

note:
- motivation is fickle and hard to maintain sometimes
- motivation: desire or impotus to maintain behavior--the energy that drives you to do something
keypoints: - desire or impotus to maintain behavior
- energy that drives you to do smth
transcript: Why does motivation seem so fickle? And what even is it in the first place? Psychologists define motivation as the desire or impetus to initiate and maintain a particular behavior. In other words, it's the energy that drives you to do something. And knowing the source of that drive is particularly important when it comes to understanding how to maintain it.
